"
Jerry J. Dawson Civic Leadership Institute

a.span: Remote Learning Plan - Guidelines for Parents
Supporting Your Kids Through the Pandemic

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

p.span: Illinois State Board of Education (ISBE) announced that remote learning will occur for the duration of the suspension of
in-person instruction, as directed by our governing systems through April 30th, 2020. As a result, districts must develop
instructional remote learning to allow for student engagement and continuity of instruction

. Students that do not have a technology device at home had the opportunity to pick up their school assigned iPad. If you need to pick up your child's iPad or need your child's grade level non-digital printouts, contact your school office.
The remote learning designation allows school districts to not extend the school year
calendar due to school closures. During the COVID-19 Emergency, all previously noted Act of God Days, Remote
Learning Planning Days, and Remote Learning Days in Illinois will count as actual days of student attendance.
The primary purpose of remote le
arning is to provide social emotional support, continue instruction and provide opportunities to improve a students
academic standing. We recognize that students and staff alike will have distractions in this remote learning
environment, and we simply ask that everyone engage to the best of their abilities.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });
